content.question: Which of the following claims best explains why John Thompson included examples of violence in the source?

choices.label: The acts of violence directed toward enslaved people in Maryland were unique and deserved to be recorded.
A strong sense of unity often developed among enslaved populations that routinely experienced violence.
Exposing readers to acts of violence endured by enslaved people was crucial to strengthening the abolitionist movement.
Highlighting the violence experienced by many enslaved people encouraged overseers to treat them more humanely.

content.answer: Exposing readers to acts of violence endured by enslaved people was crucial to strengthening the abolitionist movement.
